answerText: "When I Heard the Learn'd Astronomer"[10] "When I Heard the Learn'd Astronomer" appears in this poetry collection by Walt Whitman. Other works in it include "Crossing Brooklyn Ferry" and, in later editions, "When Lilacs Last in the Dooryard Bloom'd."
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Penn A + Chicago B | 20 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The speaker of this poem is confronted with proofs and figures that "were ranged in columns". For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem that juxtaposes the "lecture-room," where the speaker becomes unaccountably "tired and sick" with the "mystical moist night-air" through which he looks "in perfect silence at the stars."
